ab.title: Genesis 27
ab.l: And it was, when Isaac was old,and his eyes were too dim for seeing, that he calledEsau, his older son, and said to him, ‘My son!’ Andhe said to him, ‘Lo, here am I.’
And he said, ‘Lo,I grew old, I do not know the day of my death.
Sonow take your weapons, your sword, and bow, andgo out to the field, and hunt game for me.
Andmake me delicious food, such as I love, and bring it to me,and let me eat, that my soul may bless you before I die.’
And Rebekah was listening when Isaac spoketo his son Esau. And Esau went to the field to huntto bring game.
And Rebekah said to her son Jacob,saying, ‘Lo, I heard your father speaking to Esau,your brother, saying,
“Bring me gameand make me delicious food, so I may eat it and bless you beforethe Lord, before I die.”
Now therefore,my son, obey my voice to do what I am commanding you.
Go now to the flock, and take me from there twogood kids of the goats, so that I may make from them deliciousfood for your father, such as he loves.
And bring itto your father, that he may eat, and that he may bless youbefore his death.’
And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother,‘Lo, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.
Maybe my father will touch me, and I will seem in his eyesas a deceiver, and I will bring a curse on meand not a blessing.’

And his mother said to him,‘Your curse will be on me, my son, seg type="commented" n="#seg011"/because ifyour father recognizes you, you will say that it was I who commanded you to do this.anchor type="commented" xml:id="seg011"/ Onlyobey my voice, and go take them for me.’
And he wentand took and brought them to his mother, and his mother made deliciousfood, such as his father loved.
AndRebekah took the garments of Esau, her older son, thefinest of them, which were with her in the house, and she put them on Jacob,her younger son.
And she put the skins of thegoat kids on his hands and on the smoothpart of his neck.
And she gave thedelicious food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of Jacob,her son.
And he came to his father, and said, ‘My father.’And he said, ‘Lo, I am here. Who are you, my son?’
AndJacob said to his father, ‘I am Esau your firstborn. I have done allas you spoke to me. Get up, now, sit and eat of my game,so your soul will bless me.’
AndIsaac said to his son, ‘What is this? You hurried to find, my son.’ And he said,‘Because the Lord your God made me meet it before me.’
And Isaac saidto Jacob, ‘Come near, now, let me touch you, my son: is this you,my very son Esau, or not.’
And Jacob went near to Isaachis father, and he touched him, and said, ‘The voice is Jacob’s voice,but the hands are the hands of Esau.’
And he did not recognize him,because his hands were hairy, like his brother Esau’s hands,and he blessed him.
And he said, ‘Are you my veryson Esau?’ And he said, ‘I am.’
And he said, ‘Bringit near to me, and let me eat of my son’s game, so thatmy soul will bless you.’ And he brought it near to him, and he ate; and he brought himwine, and he drank.
And Isaac, his father, said to him,‘Come near now, and kiss me, my son.’
Andhe came near, and kissed him, and he smelled the smell of his garments,and he blessed him, and said, ‘See, the smell of my son is like the smellof a field which the Lord has blessed.
And mayGod give you from the dew of the skies, and from the fatnessof the earth, and plenty of grain and must.

Let peoples serve you, and nations bow down to you.Be superior over your brothers, and let your mother’s sons bow down to you.Cursed be everyone that curses you, and blessed be everyone who blesses you.’
And it was, when Isaac had finished blessingJacob, and Jacob had scarcely gone out from before Isaac,his father, that Esau his brother came from his hunting.
And he, too, had made delicious food and brought itto his father, and said to his father, ‘Let my father get up and eatof his son’s game, so your soul will bless me.’
And Isaac his father said to him, ‘Who are you?’ And he said, ‘I amyour firstborn son Esau.’

And Isaac trembled veryexceedingly, seg type="commented" n="#seg012"/for this thing did not appear to him through a prophecyanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg012"/,and said, ‘Who was it here, he that hunted game andbrought it to me? And I ate of all that I wanted before you came,and I even blessed him. He shall be blessed.’
As soon as Esau heard the words of his father, he criedwith a great and exceedingly bitter cry, and said to his father, ‘Blessme also, I am your soon, too, oh my father.’
Andhe said, ‘Your brother Isaac came with deceitfulness, and he tookyour blessing.’

And Esau said, ‘Was his name really calledJacob? And he cheated me these two times.He took my birthright, and, lo, now he has takenmy blessing.’ And he said to his father, ‘Lo, have you not left in secreta blessing for me?’

And Isaac answered andsaid to Esau, ‘Lo, I have made him your superior, andI have given all his brothers as servants, andI have sustained him with grain and must. And what shall I do here for you,my son?’
And Esau said to his father,‘Is it one blessing that you had, my father? Bless me also, I amyour soon, too, oh my father.’ And Esau raised his voice, and wept.
And Isaac his father answered and said to him,‘Lo, your dwelling will be in the fatness of the earth,and the dew of the skies from above will quench the thirstof your land.
And by your sword you will live on, andyou will serve your brother. And it shall be, when you shall gain strength,that you shall crush his yoke from your neck.’

And Esau became hostile to Jacob because of the blessingwith which his father blessed him, and Esau said in his heart,‘When the days of mourning for my father will get closer, I will kill my brother Jacob.’
And these words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah.So she sent and called Jacob,her younger son, and said to him, ‘Lo, your brother Esaubrags concerning you, to kill you.
So now, oh my son, listen to my voice and get up, fleeto Laban, my brother, to Haran.
Andlive with him some time, until your brother’s fury turns back.

Until your brother’s fury turns backfrom you and he forgets what you have done to him. And I will sendand take you from there. Why should I be deprived of the two of you as wellin one day? seg type="commented" n="#seg013"/For if he kills you, hewill be also killed.’anchor type="commented" xml:id="seg013"/
And Rebekah said to Isaac,‘I am weary of my life before the daughters of Heth. IfJacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth like thesedaughters of the land, what for is a life to me?’
